moves.1. d4 Nc6: I think this is a bit of a mistake as I can chase him.
moves.2. d5 e5: ?? And this is the blunder. I guess he just wasn't thinking.
moves.3. dxc6 Qf6: This opponent always tries to get scholar's mate, but much better would have been taking my pawn.
moves.4. cxd7+ Bxd7: Well I'm up by three points so I thought "Well this should be easy" Yeah...easy
moves.5. e4 Bc5 6. Nf3: I was feeling pretty good, not paying much attention and basically underestimating my opponent since I was ahead. I didn't notice that he had three pieces developed to my one.
moves.10. Bg4: I felt really clever making this move, I thought "ha! to stop me from playing Qd7+ he has to give up his queen!" I didn't realize I guess that it wouldn't do much.
moves.12... Ne7 13. Be3 Qxe4: Uh oh... Pawn gone. What do I do now? I know, play like an idiot
moves.14. Ke2: I saw that he could play Bxe3 f2xe3 Qxe3+ so I decided to defend my bishop. Why I couldn't have just played Nc3 counterattacking his queen is a mystery.
moves.14... Qxc2+: Um pawn gone... What do I do now?
moves.15. Nd2: Block and develop at the same time. And lose another pawn
moves.15... Bd6 16. Bg5: I was trying to keep up my 'attack' although I was still leaving my pawn hanging.
moves.16... Nc6 17. Bh5 Nd4+ 18. Ke1 Qf5 19. Q: I thought: Oh good, now the danger's over, his queen is gone and I've got an easy game. After all, I'm up a knight. I guess I didn't realize that I was also down two pawns.
moves.19... Nxf5 20. Bg4: Well in hindsight I have to admit that white is better. But I played pretty badly earlier.
moves.20... Nd4: Threatens a very obvious fork that suddenly I miss
moves.21. Ne4: See what I mean by I was playing like a 1st class idiot?
moves.21... Nc2+ 22. Kd1 Nxa1 23. Re1 f6 24. B: Well look how the tides have turned. Suddenly he's up by four points (Though his knight won't live long) and threatening a tactic that surprisingly I see. I guess the shock of his fork brought me back to reality.
moves.25. Kc1 Bb4 26. Re3 Rd4 27. Bf5 Rc4+: ? Just drives my king closer to his knight
I'm starting to think: Hey, my position isn't terrible. After I win his knight I've got the bishop pair against his rook.
moves.32. Kxa1 Kf7 33. Rxc7+: Oh yay I've equalized and I think white has the advantage now.
moves.33... Kg8 34. a3: I saw something very nice involving his back rank and my bishops that would win his rook, I bet you can find it, but first I had to deal with my back rank.
moves.36. Be6+: High-yah! I now see the possibility of more than winning his rook
And checkmate. While not a great game I felt it would be funny to annotate.
